agreement_metadata.title: Common Agreement between The Employers' Bargaining Committee and Federation of Post-Secondary Educators of BC (FPSE)

parties.union: Federation of Post-Secondary Educators of BC (FPSE)
union_locals: Faculty Association of the College of New Caledonia (FPSE Local 3)

definitions.agreement: This Common Agreement reached between the employers and the unions as defined in 'Parties' or 'Common Parties' definition
definitions.collective_agreement: The combination of provisions of the Common Agreement with local provisions that constitute a collective agreement between an institution and a local union
definitions.employee: A person employed within a bargaining unit represented by one of the unions that has ratified a Collective Agreement that includes this Common Agreement
definitions.employer: An employer that has ratified a Collective Agreement that includes this Common Agreement
definitions.institution: A post-secondary institution that has ratified a Collective Agreement that includes this Common Agreement
definitions.jadrc: Joint Administration and Dispute Resolution Committee established pursuant to Article 3.2 of this Agreement
definitions.joint_labour_management_committee: A committee formed by local parties with equal representation from a local union and an institution
definitions.local_parties: The institution and local bargaining unit where both have ratified a Collective Agreement that includes this Common Agreement
definitions.local_provision: A provision of a Collective Agreement established by negotiations between an individual employer and a local union
definitions.local_union: A bargaining unit representing employees at an institution that has ratified a Collective Agreement that includes this Common Agreement
definitions.ministry: The Ministry of Advanced Education, Skills and Training
definitions.psea: Post-Secondary Employers' Association established for post-secondary institutions under the Public Sector Employers' Act
definitions.ratification: The acceptance by a local union and by both an institution and the PSEA of the terms of a Collective Agreement that includes this Common Agreement
definitions.union: A faculty association or trade union certified as a bargaining agent

1.1.title: Purpose of Common Agreement
1.1.content: The purpose of this Agreement is to establish and maintain orderly collective bargaining procedures between the Parties and to promote the efficient and effective operation of the institution through the establishment and continuance of harmonious relations and working conditions

1.2.title: Future Legislation
1.2.content: In the event that any future legislation renders null and void or materially alters any provision of this Agreement, the Parties hereto will negotiate a mutually agreeable provision to be substituted

1.3.title: Conflict with Policies
1.3.content: Every reasonable effort will be made to harmonize employer policies with the provisions of this Agreement. In the event of a conflict between the contents of this Agreement and any policies made by the employer, the terms of this Agreement will prevail

1.4.title: Singular and Plural
1.4.content: Wherever the singular is used in the Common Agreement, the same shall be construed as meaning the plural if the context requires unless otherwise specifically stated

2.1.title: Statement of Commitment
2.1.content: The Institutions promote teaching, scholarship and research and the free and critical discussion of ideas. Unions and employers are committed to providing a working and learning environment that allows for full and free participation of all members of the institutional community

2.2.title: Definitions
2.2.content: Harassment is a form of discrimination that adversely affects the recipient on one or more of the prohibited grounds under the BC Human Rights Code. Sexual Harassment is behaviour of a sexual nature by a person who knows or ought reasonably to know that the behaviour is unwanted or unwelcome

2.3.title: Procedures
2.3.content: Local Informal Processes, Right to Legal Counsel, Mediation, and Investigation procedures are outlined for handling harassment complaints

2.4.title: Findings
2.4.content: The employer will make a written determination based upon the facts and recommendation within ten (10) working days of receipt of the Investigator's report

2.5.title: Rights of the Parties
2.5.content: Outlines rights regarding Human Rights Code complaints and disciplinary actions

2.6.title: False Complaints, Breaches of Confidentiality and Retaliatory Action
2.6.content: Frivolous, vexatious or malicious complaints of harassment or breaches of the confidentiality provisions may result in discipline

3.1.title: Human Resources Database
3.1.content: The Parties believe that their on-going and collective bargaining relationships are enhanced through useful, timely, and accessible data on relevant human resources matters

3.2.title: Joint Administration and Dispute Resolution Committee
3.2.content: The Parties will maintain a JADRC consisting of three (3) representatives of each party to assist in administration, provide dialogue forum, and resolve disputes

3.3.title: Leave of Absence for College Committees and Union Leave
3.3.content: Provisions for leave of absence for college committee participation and union business without loss of pay

4.1.title: Definition
4.1.content: Prior Learning Assessment (PLA) is the assessment by some valid and reliable means, of what has been learned through formal and non-formal education/training or experience

4.2.title: Prior Learning Assessment as Workload
4.2.content: Prior learning assessment work undertaken by an employee will be integrated into and form part of the employee's workload

4.3.title: Training in Prior Learning Assessment
4.3.content: An employee required to perform prior learning assessment has a right to employer-paid training time and expenses

4.4.title: Prior Learning Assessment Coordinators
4.4.content: Prior Learning Assessment coordinators will be faculty or instructional bargaining unit members

5.1.title: Copyright Ownership
5.1.content: Defines ownership of copyright for work products created by employees under various circumstances

5.2.title: Employer Rights to Materials Copyrighted by Employee(s)
5.2.content: Where employee holds copyright, institution has right to use copyrighted material in perpetuity for institutional purposes

5.3.title: Employee Rights to Materials Copyrighted by the Employer
5.3.content: Where institution holds copyright, employee has right to use copyrighted material in perpetuity, free of charge

5.4.title: Joint Review
5.4.content: JADRC may review issues arising from the application of this Article

6.1.title: Employee Security and Regularization
6.1.content: Provisions to ensure employee security and regularization of employees, including entitlement to regularization after specified periods of work

6.2.title: Program Transfers and Mergers
6.2.content: Procedures for when institutions transfer or merge programs affecting employees

6.3.title: Registry of Laid Off Employees
6.3.content: System-wide electronic registry of job postings and eligible employees for laid-off workers

6.4.title: Targeted Labour Adjustment
6.4.content: Menu of labour adjustment strategies to minimize layoffs including job sharing, reduced hours, transfers, and severance options

6.5.title: Contracting Out
6.5.content: Limitations on contracting out work that would result in layoffs or reduction in assigned workload

6.6.title: Education Technology/Distributed Learning
6.6.content: Provisions governing development and delivery of distributed learning programs including training, resources, and job security

7.1.title: Definitions
7.1.content: Definitions of spouse, family, and related terms for leave provisions

7.2.title: General Leave
7.2.content: Employer may grant leave with or without pay for up to twenty-four (24) consecutive months

7.3.title: Seniority Accrual
7.3.content: All paid leaves treated as continuous employment for seniority accrual purposes

7.6.title: Bereavement Leave
7.6.content: Five (5) days leave with no loss of pay and benefits for death of family member

7.7.title: Family Illness Leave
7.7.content: Up to five (5) days per year without loss of pay or benefits for family illness

7.8.title: Compassionate Care Leave
7.8.content: Up to twenty-seven (27) weeks without pay to care for gravely ill family member

7.10.title: Jury Duty and Court Appearances
7.10.content: Leave without loss of pay and benefits for jury duty or court appearances

7.11.title: Public Duties
7.11.content: Leave provisions for election activities and public office

7.13.title: Deferred Salary Leave
7.13.content: Each employer will establish deferred salary leave plan consistent with Canada Revenue Agency regulations

7.17.title: Cultural Leave for Aboriginal Employees
7.17.content: Up to three (3) days' leave with pay per calendar year for Aboriginal cultural events

8.1.title: Preamble
8.1.content: Definitions and entitlement to leave of absence without pay of up to twelve (12) consecutive months in addition to statutory requirements

8.2.title: Commencement of Leave
8.2.content: Timing provisions for when leave may commence for birth mothers, spouses, and adopting parents

8.3.title: Benefits Continuation
8.3.content: Employer maintains coverage for medical, extended health, dental, group life and disability benefits

8.4.title: Return to Work
8.4.content: Employee retains seniority and is placed in same or comparable position upon return

8.5.title: Supplemental Employment Benefit (SEB) for Maternity and Parental Leave
8.5.content: Detailed provisions for supplemental payments to Employment Insurance benefits during maternity and parental leave

9.1.title: Joint Committee on Benefits Administration
9.1.content: Establishment of Joint Committee with four (4) members from each side to oversee benefits administration

9.2.title: Specific Benefits
9.2.content: Extended Health Benefits with 95% reimbursement, Group Life and ADD at 3x annual salary, Dental Plan provisions

9.3.title: Disability Benefits
9.3.content: Single plan providing 100% salary for first 30 days, 70% for next 21 weeks, and 70% long-term disability thereafter

10.1.title: Mandatory Enrolment
10.1.content: Enrolment in the College Pension Plan as set out by the Public Sector Pension Plans Act, Schedule A

10.2.title: Existing Employees
10.2.content: Employees on payroll as of ratification who have not joined retain the right not to do so

11.1.title: Definition
11.1.content: Early retirement defined as retirement at or after age 55 and before age 64

11.2.title: Eligibility
11.2.content: Must be at highest achievable step of salary scale and have minimum of ten (10) years of full-time equivalent service

11.3.title: Incentive Payment
11.3.content: Age-based incentive payment schedule from 100% at age 55-59 down to 0% at age 64

12.1.title: Provincial Salary Scale
12.1.content: Annual salary increases of 2% effective April 1, 2019, April 1, 2020, and April 1, 2021

12.2.title: Secondary Scale Adjustment
12.2.content: All steps on secondary scales increased by 2% on same dates as provincial scale

12.3.title: Maintenance of Placement
12.3.content: Employee moving between institutions within two years maintains higher salary placement

12.4.title: Calculation of Pay
12.4.content: Institutions review division of annual pay to ensure employees receive full or pro-rated gross annual salary

12.5.title: Overload
12.5.content: Regular employee working overload receives pro-rata salary or commensurate workload reduction

12.6.title: Faculty Administrative Stipends
12.6.content: Stipends for faculty administrative positions increased by 2% on same schedule as salary scales

13.1.title: Local Agreement Supersession
13.1.content: Where local collective agreement provides greater employee benefit, local provision supersedes Common Agreement

13.2.title: Effective Date
13.2.content: All provisions effective on date of ratification except as otherwise noted

13.3.title: Exceptions to Article 13.1
13.3.content: Lists specific articles not subject to local agreement supersession

14.1.title: General
14.1.content: Employee participation voluntary, collective agreement terms apply, workload interpretation provisions

14.2.title: Expenses
14.2.content: Employer reimburses receipted expenses pursuant to policy, provides travel advances

14.3.title: Health and Welfare Benefits
14.3.content: Current benefits coverage provided, premiums paid as if working in BC, travel medical insurance supplied

14.4.title: Emergencies and Emergency Evacuation
14.4.content: 24-hour contact provisions, evacuation procedures, employer responsibility for emergency expenses

14.5.title: Orientation and Return
14.5.content: Reasonable orientation prior to departure, three working days between international assignment and regular duties

15.1.title: Equipment Provision
15.1.content: Employer supplies at no cost all health and safety apparel and equipment required by BC Workers' Compensation Act

16.1.title: Purpose
16.1.content: Fund in support of professional development activities for maintenance and development of faculty professional competence

16.2.title: Process
16.2.content: Local parties agree on process and criteria for review and adjudication of employee applications

16.3.title: Fund
16.3.content: Fund set at 0.6% of faculty salary for each institution, unspent monies retained by employer

17.1.title: Agreement Term
17.1.content: Agreement in effect from April 1, 2019 to March 31, 2022, continues until renewal

appendix_f.title: Medical Travel Referral Benefit
appendix_f.content: Benefit summary, eligible expenses, exclusions, and claims adjudication

appendix_g.title: Dental Plan
appendix_g.content: Nine month limitation details and process for more frequent cleaning

appendix_h.title: Deferred Salary Leave Application, Agreement, and Approval Form
appendix_h.content: Template form for deferred salary leave applications

appendix_i.title: Family Members for the Purpose of Article 7.8 Compassionate Care Leave
appendix_i.content: Comprehensive list of family member definitions for compassionate care leave

lou_1.title: Employment Equity – Aboriginal Employees
lou_1.content: PSEA and FPSE recognize Aboriginal employees are underrepresented and commit to redress this through special programs

lou_2.title: Medical Services Plan of BC
lou_2.content: If government reverts to individually paid premium system, employer will pay 100% of premiums

lou_3.title: Expedited Arbitration
lou_3.content: Detailed expedited arbitration process for grievance resolution excluding dismissals, suspensions over 5 days, policy grievances

lou_4.title: Working Committee on Secondary Scales
lou_4.content: Joint committee to quantify costs of transitioning non-regular faculty from secondary scales to Provincial Salary Scale

general_provisions.harassment_procedures: Comprehensive procedures including mediation and investigation options
general_provisions.dispute_resolution: JADRC established for Common Agreement dispute resolution
general_provisions.job_security: Employee security and regularization provisions with registry system for laid-off employees
general_provisions.benefits_administration: Joint Committee on Benefits Administration oversees health, welfare and disability benefits
general_provisions.professional_development: Common Faculty Professional Development Fund at 0.6% of faculty salary
general_provisions.international_education: Voluntary participation with expense reimbursement and emergency provisions
